item.dc:creator: Edward Njoroge

item.title: Vieta's formulas in elementary algebra
item.author: codingedward@gmail.com (Edward Njoroge)
item.description: Introduction By the fundamental theory of algebra, a general polynomial of the form, $$ \tag{1} f(x) = a_{n}x^{n} + a_{n-1}x^{n-1} + \cdots + a_{1}x + a_{0} = 0 $$ has at least $ n $ complex roots (not necessarily unique). Therefore, given a root $ \alpha $ of the polynomial, we can rewrite $ (1) $ as, $$ f(x) = (x - \alpha) f^’(x) = 0 $$ where $ f^’(x) $ is a polynomial of degree $(n - 1)$.
item.dc:creator: Edward Njoroge
